name: Nintendo
description: Japanese video game company known for iconic franchises like Mario, Zelda, and Pok√©mon.

name: Sony Interactive Entertainment
description: Division of Sony Corporation responsible for PlayStation consoles and exclusive games.

name: Microsoft Studios
description: Microsoft's video game development and publishing division, behind Xbox and PC titles.

name: Electronic Arts
description: One of the largest video game publishers, known for sports, action, and simulation titles.

name: Activision Blizzard
description: Major publisher formed from the merger of Activision and Blizzard Entertainment.

name: Ubisoft Entertainment
description: French video game company known for franchises like Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, and Rainbow Six.

name: Square Enix
description: Japanese developer and publisher famous for Final Fantasy, Dragon Quest, and Kingdom Hearts.

name: Capcom
description: Japanese developer and publisher known for Resident Evil, Street Fighter, and Mega Man.

name: Konami
description: Japanese entertainment company with classic franchises like Metal Gear, Castlevania, and Pro Evolution Soccer.

name: Sega
description: Japanese company originally famous for its arcade games and consoles like the Genesis.

name: Rockstar Games
description: American developer and publisher known for Grand Theft Auto and Red Dead Redemption series.

name: Valve Corporation
description: Developer and digital distribution company known for Half-Life, Portal, and the Steam platform.

name: Epic Games
description: Developer and publisher known for Fortnite and the Unreal Engine.

name: Bandai Namco Entertainment
description: Japanese publisher known for Pac-Man, Tekken, and numerous anime-based games.

name: Bethesda Softworks
description: Publisher and developer known for The Elder Scrolls, Fallout, and DOOM.

name: CD Projekt Red
description: Polish developer famous for The Witcher series and Cyberpunk 2077.

name: Insomniac Games
description: American developer known for Ratchet & Clank and Marvel's Spider-Man.

name: Naughty Dog
description: American studio known for Uncharted and The Last of Us series.

name: Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment
description: Division of Warner Bros. that publishes games based on its film and TV properties.

name: THQ Nordic
description: Austrian publisher known for reviving classic franchises and publishing diverse titles.

name: Paradox Interactive
description: Swedish publisher known for strategy games like Crusader Kings and Europa Universalis.

name: Focus Home Interactive
description: French publisher known for a variety of mid-market titles across genres.

name: Devolver Digital
description: Independent publisher known for quirky and innovative indie games.

name: Gearbox Software
description: American developer known for the Borderlands series and other FPS titles.

name: 2K Games
description: Publisher known for sports titles and franchises like BioShock and Borderlands.

name: SNK Corporation
description: Japanese company famous for its arcade fighting games and the Neo Geo platform.

name: Koei Tecmo
description: Japanese developer and publisher known for Dynasty Warriors and Dead or Alive.

name: Atlus
description: Japanese developer and publisher known for the Persona series and Shin Megami Tensei.

name: PlatinumGames
description: Japanese developer known for fast-paced action titles like Bayonetta and Nier: Automata.

name: Remedy Entertainment
description: Finnish developer known for cinematic action games like Max Payne and Control.

name: FromSoftware
description: Japanese developer known for challenging titles such as Dark Souls and Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice.

name: Sumo Digital
description: British developer known for work on various licensed and original titles.

name: Telltale Games
description: American studio known for narrative-driven adventure games, such as The Walking Dead.

name: Curve Digital
description: Publisher known for bringing indie games to a wider audience.

name: Microids
description: French developer and publisher known for adventure games like Syberia.

name: Deep Silver
description: Publisher known for franchises such as Dead Island and Metro, part of Koch Media.

name: Rovio Entertainment
description: Finnish developer best known for creating Angry Birds.

name: Supercell
description: Finnish mobile game developer known for Clash of Clans and Brawl Stars.

name: King Digital Entertainment
description: Developer and publisher famous for Candy Crush Saga.

name: GungHo Online Entertainment
description: Japanese developer and publisher known for mobile and online games.

name: NetEase Games
description: Chinese developer and publisher active in mobile and PC gaming.

name: Tencent Games
description: Division de Tencent, uno de los mayores publishers de juegos en el mundo.

name: Crytek
description: German developer known for the Crysis series and advanced game engines.

name: id Software
description: Pioneer American developer known for Doom, Quake, y Wolfenstein.

name: Tango Gameworks
description: Japanese developer known for The Evil Within series.

name: Mojang Studios
description: Swedish developer famous for Minecraft.

name: Double Fine Productions
description: American developer known for its creative and narrative-driven games.

name: 505 Games
description: Italian publisher known for a diverse portfolio of games.

name: Larian Studios
description: Belgian developer famous for the Divinity series and Baldur's Gate 3.

name: Frontier Developments
description: British developer known for simulation and management games like Elite Dangerous.
